betterquesting:10.desc:8: You're probably going to want to get some wood to build a shelter.  Let's look for some basic building materials!
Put the craft in Minecraft!  Build yourself a crafting table!

If you picked the iron on the first quest, then you'll have a nice tool to start with but choose wisely! Go ahead and make yourself some tools to start.  These tools will have to do till you start making your way through Tinkers!
No not like that you fool!  Now that you've got yourself a fancy pickaxe it's time to get some stone! Stone is a useful material for the Nether as well as for building!

Alright, time to upgrade your crafting table.  Simply put the crafting table back in the crafting grid to get the much better Crafting Station.  This Crafting Station will hold your items in place instead of dropping them all over the place.  This is great for crafting a recipe over and over again!
Get you some windows instead of building a block of wood or stone so you can see outside.
Mine up some cobblestone and make yourself a furnace or multiple if you feel so inclined!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Set Your Spawn with a Bed!
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Quick!  Before you forget, make sure you gather some wool to make a bed to set your spawn. It's dangeroud out there!
You're gonna want to get your hands on some iron to start building your tools. Either using the vanilla iron pickaxe or start on Tinkers Construct to build your pickaxe!
Starting out basic with some chests.  Better make some storage so you don't clog your inventory.

You'll want to get some food to fend off your hunger.  Especially if you are using the Ore excavation or a large tinkers tool. Setting up a farm will be especially useful early on so you can build a good stock.  An efficient farm is 9x9 with a block of water in the middle.

Chests are a thing of the past!  With a Basic Storage Drawer, you can store 64 stacks of one item which is great for storing common items like cobblestone and wood.  Great way to immediately see where an item is instead of looking through every chest.
Can store more coal to burn as well as more material to cook.  A little faster than a vanilla furnace
Same as the Gold just made of copper!
Can store more coal to burn as well as more material to cook.  Even faster than the Iron Furnace!
Can store even more coal to burn as well as more material to cook.  The fastest furnace!
Same as the gold furnace just made of silver!
Requires no fuel to cook items however, each item will take 90 seconds to smelt.
Can smelt two sets of ore at the same time!

Make yourself a Drawer Controller in order to quickly empty your inventory and a compacting drawer.  The Drawer Controller automatically puts items stat are stored in the drawers.  Has a range of 12 in all directions.  The Compacting Drawer is great for storing metals like Iron.  It will automatically make 9 Iron Ingots into a block of iron or turn them into Iron Nuggets.
Use this to upgrade how much your drawers can hold.  Tiered upgrade system!
Use the key to lock your drawer.  When you lock your drawer, if you empty the drawer it will remember the item so your drawer doesn't get mixed up.
Even More Items!
Voids any excess items that you store in the drawer.
Make the basic tables for tinkering

Create the patterns needed for making your four basic tools the Tinker's way.  These tools will level up, gain modifiers that can be applied to the tools, and parts can be replaced with better materials!
Make a sword with tinkers!

Make some patterns for the smeltery.  This will be how you use the molten metals. Let's start with a basic sword! You'll probably want to make the other patterns for your tools if you have the gold to make them!

Time to gather lots of materials to build your smeltery.  A basic smeltery only needs to be 2x2 but can be expanded when you have more material.  Read more about it in the Tinker's book to learn about the sizes.  Or ask Matt.
A shuriken is a great weapon to start with for ranged!
These tools are excellent for doing mass amounts of mining if you don't want to vein mine!
Needed for the big equipment!
Time to find some diamond and Gold!  You may want to save these ores till you work on engineering where you can double your amount you get back!
You'll need some hemp to get going with industrial crafting!
You'll need a coke oven to make Creosote.  You'll also need to make an Engineer's hammer to create the multiblock!

betterquesting:10.name:8: I Want to Be an Engineer!
betterquesting:10.desc:8: To make steel you'll need a blast furnace.  You'll have to go to the Nether before you can make this. This can eventually be upgraded to be more efficient!
No Description
Explore the Nether and see what you can find.  Let's find the forrtress!
Find the portal to the end to face the Ender Dragon!
Sorround a 2x2 pool of water with flowers and through a diamond in.  Get ready for the Twilight Zone
You'll need some Obsidian to build what will most likely be your first portal!
No Description
Beginning in this crazy world
A better way to store and cook up your stuff!
Leveling up with Tools!
Let's get industrial up in here!
Quests for all of the dimensions!
